Intent: Why am I having it?
Response: The body produces an egg every month. The uterus lining gets thicker to prepare for a egg that is fertilized in case the woman becomes pregnant. If the egg is not fertilized, the body gets rid of it. The lining is then released from the body as blood through the vagina. This monthly process is called menstruation or a period. So when a girl has her period, her body is just getting rid of a small amount of blood and some unneeded tissue. It is a natural, normal body process for all females as they become women and mature physically.
